content.description: An incredible climb! Honestly, probably one of the most enjoyable powerful boulder problems in Rumney.Stand start under the large overhang with large holds on the pedestal. Pick some feet on the slab and stand up to an edge on the steep overhang.Â From here make a big committing move to the large sloping horn on the lip of the roof. Figure out how to match, then continue out right on the flat fin-like lip until a jug can be reached. Once here, execute an exposed and committing mantle over a less than ideal landing.
content.protection: Minimum 4 pads. Honestly 8-10 would be better.
content.location: This boulder is found at the top of the cluster. From the top of this boulder, Lower Vader is clearly visible.Best approach from the Beaver Block is to reach "Limerence" and climb up the slab to the left where the large tree is. This approach puts you on the same tier as "Stopping the Flow of Time". The boulder will be clearly visible and only 50 yards away.

content.description: Stand start on the large flat rail on the lip of the boulder. Find some smears and make your way right wards to the apex of the protruding horn feature and mantle onto the top of the boulder.
content.location: The left side of the prominent boulder.

content.description: Sit start with both hands on the left leaning diagonal lip. Make a few moves up then mantle up to the next lip. Once here traverse the lip out right to the end and mantle. An aesthetic block with a cool mantle leading into the traverse.
content.location: This boulder is found adjacent to "Stopping the Flow of Time". Together, the two blocks form an aesthetic alcove. It is found just above the Beaver Block and "Limerence".

content.description: Start standing under the majestic prow with a low sloping undercling for the left and a voguish right hand pinch on the arete. Hug the block and pull onto the wall. Move up a series of left-hand holds on the overhang and sloping pinches on the arete. An exciting and technical last move gains some satisfying holds at the top of the boulder allowing for an easy press on to the top.
content.protection: 3+ pads. Part of the landing is a ramp, part is semi-flat, then there is a chasm behind the landing that isn't quite in the fall zone.
content.location: This boulder sits in the clearing about 30-40 yards behind the Beaver Block and "Eager Beaver". The striking boulder gazes over the hillside by its lonesomeness.

content.description: An aesthetic sloping roof arete.Sit start matched low on the arete with a large foot feature. There is a large tree just to the left. Pull on and move up a series of pinches and slopers before making a hard move to a Gaston and a crux move to a good hold at the apex of the arete. Smack up some more meathooks and stand onto the slab and top it out.
content.protection: 3 pads. Landing is decent. There is a small ditch and a rock under the roof that could prove to be hazards.
content.location: This roof arete is on a higher tier than the Beaver Block and overlooks the Beta Bunch. The roof is hard to miss. When looking at "Eager Beaver" and "Mead Cannons" spin 90 degrees Counterclockwise and this boulder is seen on the left.

content.description: Sit start matched in the large horizontal. Move up to the lip of the book shelf and figure out how to mantle onto the top.
content.location: This line is hard to miss once you know it is a thing. It is found about 10 yards left of "Limerance".

content.description: Sit start matched on the large horizontal shelf. Pull on with difficulty and figure out some trickery then smack up to some bad slopers on the arete. From here latch a small sharp crimp and stand tall to a good hold at the lip before tipping out.
content.protection: 2 pads. There was a protruding death spike behind this, but a giant piece of choss covered up half of it.
content.location: This problem is a right leaning left arete on the outside of a corridor. There is a faint trail leading to it from the main Waimea Trail.

content.description: Stand start the lip of the steep overhand with a crescent shaped edge for the left and a textured sloper for the right. Pull in and move up to a sloper pinch, then make a big move up to the sloping lip. Match, then head left and topout.
content.protection: 3 pads and a spotter. Landing is meh, but decent. There is a 15 foot pit you could kick your spotter into though
content.location: This problem is on the right side of the Limerence Roof.

content.description: This area is a cluster of blocks found near the larger more prominent Beaver Block. The area requires some slight beta to navigate. Once accustomed to the area though, this is one of the more gorgeous and aesthetic locations I have found in Rumney.
